You're the one who made the claim human-caused climate change violates the 2nd law of Thermodynamics. That is false. The greenhouse effect doesn‚Äôt move net heat from a colder atmosphere to a warmer surface. It simply slows the loss of heat, changing the net energy balance so Earth warms over time.

Scientists have addressed exactly these kinds of 'plain English' questions. The Greenhouse Effect doesn't violate the Second Law of Thermodynamics because the 'net flow' of heat remains from warmer (Earth) to colder (space/atmosphere), even though greenhouse gases slow the loss of heat.

And I am saying that is false. Over here in reality, experts routinely explain why Greenhouse effect does not violate Second law of thermodynamics. Scientists have published detailed studies under their real names explaining this mechanism. Not their fault they don't then argue with bloggers after.
